study.summary: Motion sensors report unauthorized movement near crew quarters during off-watch hours.

answers.text: Lockdown the corridor, dispatch security teams to sweep, and use biometric logs to identify the intruder.
answers.details: Immediate containment minimizes risk to crew; biometric cross-checks help identify intent and prevent escape.

answers.text: Sound general alarm and evacuate nearby compartments while calling for backup.
answers.details: Rapid evacuation protects civilians but may allow intruder to move into less-populated areas; useful if threat level unclear.

answers.text: Monitor sensors and attempt to track intruder remotely before committing teams.
answers.details: Less proactive; avoids unnecessary confrontation but risks intruder reaching critical areas if tracking fails.

study.summary: Unauthorized attempts to alter life-support setpoints are detected in engineering logs.

answers.text: Isolate life-support controls to maintenance mode, switch to manual overrides, and detain any suspicious personnel in engineering.
answers.details: Protects crew immediately and secures systems; manual control prevents automated tampering from taking effect.

answers.text: Restore previous safe setpoints from backups and continue system monitoring while investigating.
answers.details: Restores safety but may leave a window for repeat tampering if malicious actor remains free.

answers.text: Alert command and wait for orders before taking action to avoid misidentifying a maintenance routine.
answers.details: Cautious approach reduces false-positive risk but delays response to an active sabotage attempt.

study.summary: Security personnel on an away mission are caught in a planned ambush while moving through dense foliage.

answers.text: Establish immediate perimeter, return fire to suppress attackers, and execute a phased withdrawal to a defensible extraction point.
answers.details: Suppressive action and an organized withdrawal preserve team integrity and create space for medevac if needed.

answers.text: Scatter and attempt to regroup at previously agreed rendezvous coordinates.
answers.details: Can reduce casualties if perimeter breached but risks isolating team members and complicating rescue.

answers.text: Push forward aggressively to seize the high ground and deny enemy firing positions.
answers.details: High-risk, high-reward; may end ambush quickly but could increase exposure to hidden threats.

study.summary: A phaser discharge is logged in a non-combat zone with no authorized training scheduled.

answers.text: Secure the area, account for all personnel, and perform weapon system diagnostics and ammo logs to trace the source.
answers.details: Combines safety, accountability, and technical verification to determine whether incident is accidental or malicious.

answers.text: Place the ship on heightened alert for internal threats while awaiting a commander-led inquiry.
answers.details: Proactive security posture but may cause unnecessary alarm to crew and hamper normal operations.

answers.text: Assume accidental discharge and issue a formal reprimand after a brief investigation.
answers.details: Quick and administratively light but risks missing deliberate misuse or system faults.

study.summary: External access attempts detected targeting the armory control authentication service.

answers.text: Isolate the armory network, enforce multi-factor manual authentication for weapons access, and initiate a full forensics sweep.
answers.details: Prevents unauthorized access while enabling investigators to trace intrusion vectors and actors.

answers.text: Shut down remote weapon access entirely until the intrusion source is eliminated.
answers.details: Effective immediate protection but reduces readiness and may hinder legitimate urgent access.

answers.text: Monitor the intrusion to gather intelligence on the attacker’s methods before cutting access.
answers.details: Potentially valuable intel but risks the attacker succeeding if monitoring delays isolation.

study.summary: A detained suspect incites other prisoners, overwhelming nearby security personnel.

answers.text: Deploy non-lethal area suppression, segregate instigators, and secure transport protocols to move prisoners to reinforced cells.
answers.details: Minimizes injuries, removes leadership of the riot, and restores order without escalating force.

answers.text: Call engineering to seal ventilation and lock down sections while awaiting reinforcements.
answers.details: Effective containment but risks suffocating or creating panic among detainees if misused.

answers.text: Use lethal force to neutralize primary threats immediately to prevent further spread.
answers.details: Guaranteed suppression but may lead to legal and ethical consequences.

study.summary: External sensor jamming makes it difficult to identify small craft approaching during a busy docking maneuver.

answers.text: Switch to manual visual confirmation via ports and deploy security shuttles to intercept unknown contacts.
answers.details: Maintains situational awareness and intercepts potential threats while navigation completes docking safely.

answers.text: Abort docking until jamming source is identified and cleared.
answers.details: Conservative solution that prioritizes safety but disrupts schedule and logistics.

answers.text: Proceed using assumption-based sensor filters and rely on automated collision avoidance.
answers.details: Risky when identification is uncertain; may place ship in danger if jamming conceals hostile craft.

study.summary: Repeated maintenance overrides by a technician appear outside scheduled windows and with odd justifications.

answers.text: Privately interview the technician under security observation and audit their recent access logs and communications.
answers.details: Direct scrutiny uncovers intent while minimizing crew alarm and preserving evidence chain.

answers.text: Revoke the technician’s access pending a wider security review of maintenance protocols.
answers.details: Immediate risk mitigation but may damage trust and delay essential repairs.

answers.text: Monitor activity silently to gather more evidence before making any personnel moves.
answers.details: May build a stronger case but allows continued risk if the technician acts maliciously again.

study.scenario: Chemical Agent Detected in Cargo Hold
study.summary: Environmentals detect trace levels of a toxic compound in an incoming cargo manifest.

answers.text: Quarantine the cargo hold, activate filtration and decontamination protocols, and call medical for exposure assessment.
answers.details: Protects crew health and contains contamination while enabling safe handling and investigation.

answers.text: Offload cargo to exposed quarantine containers for analysis at the next port.
answers.details: Removes hazard from ship but requires safe transfer procedures and may spread risk if mishandled.

answers.text: Ignore initial trace levels if within acceptable thresholds and re-inspect at scheduled intervals.
answers.details: Low disruption but risks gradual exposure if readings were underreported or worsen.

study.summary: Multiple hull breaches and unauthorized boarding signatures are detected near engineering.

answers.text: Seal bulkhead compartments, engage automated defense turrets, and deploy armed response teams to contain and eject boarders.
answers.details: Combines passive containment, automated defense, and focused team action to stop boarding before it spreads.

answers.text: Attempt to negotiate with boarding party via hailing frequencies while preparing boarding teams.
answers.details: May de-escalate if attackers seek ransom or communication; riskier if attackers are intent on sabotage.

answers.text: Initiate self-destruct of affected micro-sectors to eliminate boarders' foothold.
answers.details: Extreme measure that denies boarders but risks significant ship damage and crew safety.

study.summary: A deployed recon drone in hostile territory begins relaying altered telemetry and audiovisual feeds.

answers.text: Terminate the drone’s uplink, perform a remote forensic dump, and self-destruct it to prevent compromise spread.
answers.details: Protects intel integrity, prevents adversaries from using drone as a backdoor, and recovers evidence for analysis.

answers.text: Attempt to retake control and land the drone for inspection if signal remains stable.
answers.details: Recovers asset and data but risks further compromise if attacker retains partial control.

answers.text: Ignore anomalies and continue mission to maintain cover in hostile environment.
answers.details: Maintains mission presence; risky because compromised feeds could mislead operators.

study.summary: Security scanners flag a container as explosive, but visual inspection suggests packaging error.

answers.text: Evacuate nearby areas, use remote handling rigs to isolate and x-ray the container, then neutralize if confirmed.
answers.details: Prioritizes safety while minimizing crew exposure and preserving evidence for chain-of-custody.

answers.text: Open the container in place using standard protocols since visual cues show non-threatening contents.
answers.details: Faster resolution but risks accidental detonation if scanner was accurate.

answers.text: Label as false positive and return to normal operations to avoid disrupting logistics.
answers.details: Efficient for benign errors but dangerous if misclassification occurs.

study.summary: Security receives reports of forged crew IDs used to access restricted areas.

answers.text: Run a shipwide authentication sweep, invalidate suspect badges, and require biometric re-enrollment.
answers.details: Restores access integrity and ensures only verified personnel can enter sensitive zones.

answers.text: Increase random spot checks at critical access points and monitor for repeat offenders.
answers.details: Deters casual misuse but may miss coordinated forgery rings.

answers.text: Assume administrative error and update badge reader firmware to reduce false acceptance.
answers.details: May reduce technical false positives but does not address intentional forgery.

study.summary: A diplomatic security detail encounters an armed separatist group demanding the release of prisoners.

answers.text: Maintain cover, de-escalate verbally while tactical units prepare a silent takedown at a commander’s go.
answers.details: Prioritizes saving lives while preparing decisive intervention if negotiations fail.

answers.text: Refuse demands and demonstrate force posture to intimidate the group into surrender.
answers.details: May compel surrender but risks provoking immediate violence and civilian casualties.

answers.text: Comply with demands to buy time and avoid bloodshed, planning to recapture later.
answers.details: Temporary peace but concedes tactical advantage and may embolden future demands.

study.summary: Cargo manifests show discrepancies suggesting illicit transport of contraband technologies.

answers.text: Hold the vessel at customs, perform a targeted search of suspect containers, and detain implicated crew for questioning.
answers.details: Direct action prevents contraband from moving and preserves legal caseability against smugglers.

answers.text: Track the shipment covertly to identify the broader smuggling network before intervening.
answers.details: May dismantle network but risks contraband reaching end-users during surveillance.

answers.text: Flag as paperwork error and release the shipment to avoid disrupting trade relations.
answers.details: Avoids friction but allows potential contraband to circulate.

study.summary: A scheduled active-shooter training is mistaken for a real event by junior crew, causing panic.

answers.text: Immediately broadcast a clear all-hands message clarifying the exercise, pause the drill, and counsel affected crew.
answers.details: Restores order, reduces trauma, and provides learning opportunity to improve drill protocols.

answers.text: Continue the drill to capitalize on realistic reactions as a training opportunity.
answers.details: Maximizes training fidelity but risks real psychological harm and undermines trust.

answers.text: Cancel the exercise and discipline organizers for poor communication.
answers.details: Establishes accountability but loses pedagogical value and may be excessively punitive.

study.scenario: Sealed Compartment with Unknown Life Signs
study.summary: A sealed maintenance compartment returns faint non-human life signs on thermal scans.

answers.text: Approach with hazard protocols, use remote manipulation to open, and be prepared for containment or first contact procedures.
answers.details: Balances safety with compassion and readiness for biological unknowns or surprise threats.

answers.text: Vent the compartment to the exterior and neutralize any life signs as potential hazard.
answers.details: Defensive and safe but risks violating ethical first-contact protocols.

answers.text: Ignore ambiguous readings as sensor noise and reopen normally during scheduled maintenance.
answers.details: Minimal disruption but risks exposing crew to unknown organisms or traps.

study.summary: A local ferry approaches with insufficient clearance codes and requests emergency docking.

answers.text: Hold the ferry at remote docking, perform a remote scan, and verify identities before granting access.
answers.details: Prevents hostage or infiltration scenarios while providing aid if genuine emergency.

answers.text: Allow immediate docking to offer humanitarian assistance, trusting local authority signals.
answers.details: Helps genuine cases quickly but may allow hostile actors aboard.

answers.text: Refuse docking and advise the ferry to seek assistance at nearest port.
answers.details: Safe refusal but may abandon legitimate civilians in need.

study.summary: A phaser discharged during a training session fails to cycle correctly and emits an atypical beam.

answers.text: Quarantine weapons, secure the firing range, and run diagnostic and maintenance protocols before further use.
answers.details: Prevents further misfires and ensures weapons are safe and reliable before returning to service.

answers.text: Continue training with reduced power settings while techs monitor performance.
answers.details: Keeps schedule but risks repeat malfunction and unsafe conditions.

answers.text: Ignore the anomaly as an isolated sensor glitch and resume normal training.
answers.details: Quick fix but may allow dangerous weapons faults to persist.

study.summary: Multiple conflicting orders are issued during a hull breach response, causing team paralysis.

answers.text: Assert security command control, re-establish clear single-point orders, and document deviations for after-action review.
answers.details: Restores decisive action and creates accountability to correct leadership issues.

answers.text: Hold current positions until a higher-ranking officer clarifies instructions.
answers.details: Reduces risk of conflicting movement but delays urgent actions needed to save lives.

answers.text: Allow squad leaders to act independently to solve local problems quickly.
answers.details: Empowers initiative but risks uncoordinated efforts that may conflict strategically.

study.summary: Unidentified micro-beacons are found attached to hull fittings suggesting tracking by hostile actors.

answers.text: Remove and catalog beacons for forensic analysis, sweep hull for additional devices, and harden external protocols.
answers.details: Preserves evidence, prevents additional tracking, and informs counter-surveillance measures.

answers.text: Ignore as cosmetic debris unless telemetry confirms hostile usage.
answers.details: Minimizes disruption but risks missing coordinated espionage operations.

answers.text: Broadcast publicly that beacons will be removed to deter further placements.
answers.details: Deterrent effect may be limited and alerts adversaries to security responses.

study.summary: A security patrol is confronted by armed locals enforcing a restricted zone while conducting surface rescue ops.

answers.text: Use non-lethal area denial to create space, communicate intent, and offer to coordinate through neutral mediators.
answers.details: De-escalates potential violence and preserves diplomatic channels while ensuring mission completion.

answers.text: Raise weapons and assert authority to push through the patrol.
answers.details: May complete mission faster but risks casualties and diplomatic fallout.

answers.text: Abort surface operation and withdraw to ship to avoid engagement.
answers.details: Preserves crew safety but fails mission objectives and concedes ground.

study.summary: Someone attempts to access a secure vault using a cloned biometric signature.

answers.text: Require secondary manual authentication and camera verification, detain the user for investigation, and audit biometric logs.
answers.details: Combines layered security and human verification to stop sophisticated cloning attacks.

answers.text: Allow access but flag the session and trace activity for evidence collection.
answers.details: May collect attacker intel but risks exposure of secured assets during the session.

answers.text: Disable biometric access entirely and switch to code locks until biometrics can be reissued.
answers.details: Effective short-term shield but disrupts normal operations and can be socially disruptive.

study.summary: Civil unrest on a colony surface threatens both civilians and security teams trying to stabilize the area.

answers.text: Establish secure corridors for evacuation, deploy non-lethal crowd control, and work with local leaders to open dialogue.
answers.details: Protects lives, reduces confrontation, and targets root causes by involving community leadership.

answers.text: Use precision strikes to remove instigators and restore order by force.
answers.details: Quick suppression but risks civilian casualties and long-term resentment.

answers.text: Enforce a curfew and hold positions until civil order returns naturally.
answers.details: Low-contact approach but may prolong unrest and risk spread of violence.

study.scenario: Tampered Safety Protocols in Shuttle Bay
study.summary: Safety interlocks in the shuttle bay have been bypassed, risking uncontrolled launches.

answers.text: Lock down shuttle bay operations, run a full audit of recent access, and re-engage interlocks with forced authentication.
answers.details: Immediate prevention of accidental or malicious launches and identification of perpetrators.

answers.text: Run controlled test launches under supervision to verify systems before resuming full ops.
answers.details: Validates operability but risks initiating an incident if tampering remains undetected.

answers.text: Assume a maintenance error and reset protocols to factory defaults to clear overrides.
answers.details: Quick technical reset but may erase forensic data and hide malicious intent.

study.summary: Command staff receives anonymous encrypted threats referencing classified operations.

answers.text: Trace message headers, isolate affected staff for protection, and coordinate with intelligence for attribution.
answers.details: Protects potential targets while pursuing the originator through technical and HUMINT methods.

answers.text: Treat as prank and increase personal security awareness without formal escalation.
answers.details: Avoids panic but risks underestimating genuine threats.

answers.text: Publicize the threats to deter attackers and encourage witnesses to come forward.
answers.details: May mobilize community support but leaks classified references and can escalate fear.

study.summary: A forged transmission claims senior officers have ordered mutiny, causing confusion among lower-deck crew.

answers.text: Secure official communications channels, broadcast authenticated counter-orders, and detain anyone propagating the false transmission.
answers.details: Restores legitimate chain of command and deters further misinformation by swift, authoritative correction.

answers.text: Lock down internal comms and vet messages manually to prevent spread until source identified.
answers.details: Prevents further spread but slows normal operations and may cause frustration.

answers.text: Ignore and continue with existing mission orders assuming crew will recognize falsehood quickly.
answers.details: Avoids overreaction but risks sinking morale and allowing confusion to grow.

study.summary: A localized radiation leak coincides with a theft from a secure lab, suggesting coordinated diversion tactics.

answers.text: Contain the leak with engineering, prioritize victim rescue, then preserve crime scene for investigation once safe.
answers.details: Balances humanitarian response with preservation of evidence to identify culprits once area is safe.

answers.text: Pursue suspects immediately while containment continues to prevent further thefts.
answers.details: Aggressive approach may recover property but risks crew exposure to radiation.

answers.text: Treat as two unrelated incidents to avoid overcomplicating response chains.
answers.details: Simplifies response but misses chance to expose coordinated hostile activity.

study.summary: Rescue beacons in a sector are found emitting false coordinates, potentially luring ships into traps.

answers.text: Disable suspect beacons, circulate updated NAV alerts, and establish verification protocols for future emergency signals.
answers.details: Prevents further trap exploitation and restores trust in emergency systems via stronger verification.

answers.text: Respond to beacons with armed escort to mitigate potential ambushes.
answers.details: Maintains rescue posture but risks escort crews being drawn into prepared traps.

answers.text: Ignore the beacons until HQ confirms legitimacy to avoid baiting a trap.
answers.details: Safe but may abandon genuine distress calls and cost lives.

study.summary: An undercover security informant embedded in a crime ring risks being revealed after a compromised rendezvous.

answers.text: Execute an extraction plan immediately, provide witness protection, and feed false leads to misdirect adversaries.
answers.details: Removes the asset from danger, preserves their intelligence value, and disrupts adversary responses.

answers.text: Abort extraction to avoid exposing wider operations and re-plan a more covert retrieval.
answers.details: May keep broader ops intact but endangers the agent if delay allows exposure.

answers.text: Signal the agent to cease contact and continue observation remotely.
answers.details: Preserves surveillance but increases risk to the asset on the ground.

study.summary: Multiple navigation buoys near a shipping lane are found repositioned to cause collisions.

answers.text: Reposition buoys to safe coordinates, notify maritime traffic, and investigate origin points for prosecution.
answers.details: Immediate hazard removal combined with investigation protects civilians and deters repetition.

answers.text: Monitor traffic closely and issue temporary speed limits to reduce collision risk.
answers.details: Mitigates some risk but does not remove the underlying navigational hazard.

answers.text: Assume natural displacement and recalibrate buoys during scheduled maintenance.
answers.details: Low urgency response that may allow further incidents if deliberate tampering continues.

study.summary: Malware causes cargo-handling robots to misplace or damage sensitive shipments.

answers.text: Isolate robotics network, switch to manual handling with human oversight, and perform a full cyber-forensic sweep.
answers.details: Stops ongoing damage, secures evidence for attribution, and restores safe operations under manual control.

answers.text: Patch systems live to close vulnerability while continuing automated handling with increased monitoring.
answers.details: Maintains throughput but risks incomplete remediation if attack persists.

answers.text: Restart robot clusters to clear transient faults and resume operations.
answers.details: May temporarily clear symptoms but can erase volatile forensic data and not prevent reinfection.

study.summary: A swarm of small, weaponized craft approaches the ship using hit-and-run tactics to overwhelm point defenses.

answers.text: Activate layered defensive patterns, soft-block swarms with EMP bursts, and deploy interceptor drones to thin numbers.
answers.details: Combines area suppression, electronic countermeasures, and active interception to neutralize swarm threats efficiently.

answers.text: Focus all fire on the largest craft assuming it is the command node to disrupt coordination.
answers.details: Potentially cripples swarm command but risks allowing many attackers to persist.

answers.text: Evasive maneuvers at high speed to outrun swarm engagement windows.
answers.details: May avoid damage but can be fuel-intensive and unsuitable in constrained space.

study.summary: An incoming ship calls for help claiming hull failure but arrives under blockade where smugglers operate.

answers.text: Approach with caution, validate hull integrity remotely, and send under-escort teams with non-lethal posture until cleared.
answers.details: Balances humanitarian assistance with security, reducing chances of being used as a trojan for hostile actors.

answers.text: Grant emergency entry to expedite assistance without escort to preserve life.
answers.details: May save lives quickly but increases risk of infiltration or contraband transfer.

answers.text: Deny entry and direct the ship to nearest port due to high-risk blockade protocols.
answers.details: Defensive posture that prioritizes ship security but may cause preventable loss of life.
